subject: Gardening
title: Compost Tea: Science vs. Hype
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Compost Tea: Science vs. Hype.

hook.text: Compost teaâ€”steeping compost in water to brew a microbial tonicâ€”is wildly popular. The science is less enthusiastic.

buildup.text: Proponents claim compost tea suppresses disease, boosts plant immunity, and replaces chemical fertilizers.

discovery.text: Peer-reviewed studies show mixed results. Some batches suppress disease; others have no effect or spread harm.

twist.text: The variability depends on brewing conditions, compost source, and temperature. No two batches are identical.

climax.text: Compost applied directly to soil has more consistent benefits than tea. The brewing step may not add reliable value.

punchline.text: Skip the tea. Just apply the compost directly.
